macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Close Mixed on Thursday as Defense Stocks Rally
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose less than 0.1% while the Dow gained 0.6% and Nasdaq fell 0.4% on January 8th. Defense contractors including Northrop Grumman, Lockheed Martin, and L3Harris Technologies led gains following President Trump's announcement of plans to increase defense spending sharply.

items.title: Energy Stocks Surge Amid Geopolitical Tensions and Oil Rally
items.summary: Energy and industrial stocks led market gains on January 8th following a sharp rally in oil prices. Geopolitical concerns, including reported strikes on Iranian pipelines and gas shortages, are driving fears of potential supply shocks and supporting energy sector performance.

items.title: Markets Await January Jobs Report Before Major Macro Bets
items.summary: Traders remained cautious on January 8th ahead of Friday's employment data release. The U.S. and Canadian labor reports, scheduled for 8:30 A.M. on January 9th, are expected to drive significant volatility as institutional investors position for their first major macro bets of 2026.

items.title: Year-to-Date Stock Performance Shows Broad Gains Across Indexes
items.summary: Through January 8th, the Dow is up 2.5%, the S&P 500 is up 1.1%, the Nasdaq is up 1%, and the Russell 2000 is up 4.9% for the year, with smaller-cap stocks showing particular strength.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Holds Near $91,000 Amid Options Expiry and Macro Uncertainty
items.summary: Bitcoin traded around $90,000-$91,000 as $2.2 billion in BTC and ETH options expired on Deribit, with prices pinned near max pain levels. The market awaited key catalysts including the US employment report and a Supreme Court ruling on Trump tariffs.

items.title: Ethereum Surges 10% YTD Following Fusaka Network Upgrade
items.summary: Ethereum rose approximately 10% since the start of 2026 to around $3,200 after developers activated the Fusaka upgrade (BPO-2) on January 7, which increased blockchain throughput and reduced transaction fees.

items.title: Altcoins Outpace Bitcoin with XRP Surging Over 25%
items.summary: Major altcoins showed strong growth in early January, with XRP surging over 25%, Ethereum up 10%, and Solana continuing recovery ahead of an expected ETF launch. The global crypto market cap exceeded $3 trillion.

items.title: Crypto Markets Face Volatility From US Employment Data and Tariff Ruling
items.summary: Traders braced for volatility from the US December employment report and a Supreme Court decision on Trump tariff authority, both due on January 9. A stronger US dollar and tariff uncertainty have weighed on non-yielding assets like Bitcoin.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Declines 2.58% to $3.08 Trillion
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market capitalization fell to $3.08 trillion, down 2.58% over the previous day, as thin liquidity fueled choppy price action across major cryptocurrencies.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI in 2026: Five Defining Themes for Enterprise AI
items.summary: SAP executives identify five critical themes shaping enterprise AI in 2026, including specialized foundation models optimized for specific domains like video generation and relational models for business tasks, and the shift toward AI-native software architecture.

items.title: TechBio Survey Shows Claude Gaining Ground, Increased Machine Learning Adoption
items.summary: The fourth annual State of TechBio survey reveals significant year-over-year gains in Claude usage among biotech professionals, a sharp decline in proprietary model adoption to 44%, and nearly half of respondents now doing daily machine learning work.

items.title: AI Could Optimize Power Grids for Efficiency and Renewable Integration
items.summary: MIT researchers highlight how machine learning can improve power grid efficiency, increase resilience to extreme weather, and enable greater renewable energy integration, while addressing the challenge of building AI models that respect physical grid constraints.

items.title: MaestroX Expands Human-Guided AI Capabilities for Title Intelligence
items.summary: MaestroX announced continued expansion of its human-guided AI platform that combines advanced AI with domain expertise for title workflows, demonstrating a verified 5-to-1 return on investment with plans for additional AI capabilities in 2026.

items.title: LG Presents Affectionate Intelligence Approach at CES 2026
items.summary: LG outlined its vision for AI evolving from a collection of features into more contextual, action-oriented technology at CES 2026.

items.title: DARPA's ML2P Program Tackles Energy Efficiency in Machine Learning
items.summary: DARPA's Mapping Machine Learning to Physics program aims to redefine power as a first-class citizen in machine learning workflows to address energy challenges for modern battlefields.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Rockstar confirms Grand Theft Auto 6 has suffered three separate leaks
items.summary: Court proceedings have revealed that Grand Theft Auto 6 has leaked three times, with Rockstar Games confirming multiple unauthorized disclosures of the in-development title.

items.title: Xbox announces new Developer Direct featuring Fable and Forza Horizon 6
items.summary: Microsoft has announced its next Xbox Developer Direct showcase for January 22, highlighting new Fable gameplay and a look at Forza Horizon 6, with Playground Games presenting both titles.

items.title: 007 First Light PC requirements revealed and NVIDIA RTX features confirmed
items.summary: IO Interactive has unveiled minimum and recommended 1080p PC specs for 007 First Light at CES 2026 and confirmed collaboration with NVIDIA to add DLSS 4, Multi Frame Generation, and other RTX features.

items.title: NVIDIA GeForce NOW expands to Linux and Amazon Fire TV with new features
items.summary: NVIDIA announced that GeForce NOW is launching on Linux and Amazon Fire TV, adding support for flight sticks and highlighting its RTX Blackwell-based 5K 120 FPS cloud gaming capabilities.

items.title: Corsair showcases new gaming, streaming, and local AI hardware platform at CES 2026
items.summary: Corsair is using CES 2026 to present an expanded ecosystem that ties together gaming, streaming, content creation, productivity, and local AI computing, with Stream Deck positioned as a central control hub.

items.title: Block Blast! reaches 70M daily active users and 300M monthly active users
items.summary: Mobile title Block Blast! has scaled to 70 million DAU and 300 million MAU globally, with developer Hungry Studio crediting over 10,000 A/B tests run in a single year for its growth.

items.title: Xsolla announces UK events program to support game developers
items.summary: Game commerce firm Xsolla has outlined a series of events and activations across the UK from January 10–22, 2026, aimed at fostering partnerships and investment in the region’s games ecosystem.

items.title: CWA Canada presses Ubisoft for answers on Halifax studio closure
items.summary: CWA Canada has asked Ubisoft’s lawyers for clarification and information following the publisher’s decision to shutter its Halifax studio, raising concerns about workers affected by the closure.

items.title: Ghost of Yotei and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 lead 2026 DICE Awards nominations
items.summary: The Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences has announced the 2026 DICE Awards nominations, with Ghost of Yotei and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 among the most recognized titles.

items.title: Report: EB Games plans to close all New Zealand stores
items.summary: A report indicates that GameStop-owned EB Games has proposed shutting down all of its retail locations in New Zealand, signaling a major contraction of its physical presence in the region.

items.title: Phasmophobia studio Kinetic Games launches indie publishing label
items.summary: Kinetic Games, the developer behind Phasmophobia, has created a new indie publishing label intended to support and publish other independent game projects.

items.title: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance joins Nintendo Switch Online GameCube library
items.summary: Nintendo has added Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance to the Nintendo Switch Online classic catalog, increasing the number of available GameCube titles on the service to eight.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: CES 2026 showcases paper‑thin LG OLED Wallpaper TV, Lego Smart Play, and Razer ‘Project Motoko’ headset
items.summary: At CES 2026 in Las Vegas, LG publicly demoed its new ultra‑thin OLED evo W6 ‘Wallpaper’ TV in 77‑ and 83‑inch sizes, featuring a near edge‑to‑edge display with inputs separated into an external box for wireless 4K streaming, while Lego unveiled ‘Lego Smart Play,’ a connected Star Wars–themed platform using sensor‑equipped smart bricks and tagged minifigures that trigger coordinated lights and sounds to ‘bring builds to life.’ Razer also showed ‘Project Motoko,’ an over‑ear, network‑connected headset concept that mimics smart‑glasses functions by handling tasks like real‑time translation and information lookup via voice, indicating a push to blend wearables, entertainment, and utility hardware at the show.

items.title: Fermilab finishes construction of laser lab for world’s largest vertical atom interferometer
items.summary: Fermilab announced completion of the laser laboratory that will host the world’s largest vertical atom interferometer, a highly sensitive quantum instrument that uses laser‑cooled atoms to probe gravity and fundamental physics over a very tall vertical baseline. The facility is a major infrastructure milestone for future precision measurements in areas such as gravitational physics, quantum sensing, and potentially geophysics, positioning the U.S. lab at the forefront of large‑scale atom interferometry research.
